snippet: After criticism from Representative Jason Chaffetz, a Secret Service official suggested the agency leak the information that Mr. Chaffetz had been turned down when he applied to be an agent in 2003.
abstract: Department of Homeland Security inspector general's report reveals senior Secret Service official Edward Lowery suggested to his deputy Faron Paramore that unflattering information about Rep Jason Chaffetz should be leaked to press; Chaffetz has been one of most outspoken critics of agency; report shows dozens of agents inappropriately accessed network containing files about people rejected by agency, of which Chaffetz was one.
lead_paragraph: After criticism from Representative Jason Chaffetz, a Secret Service official suggested the agency leak the information that Mr. Chaffetz had been turned down when he applied to be an agent in 2003.

headline.main: Senior Secret Service Official Proposed Embarrassing a Critic in Congress
headline.print_headline: Senior Secret Service Official Proposed Embarrassing a Critic in Congress
